test_description: Verify automated routing logic correctly assigns service center based on brand authorization and geospatial polygon
business_risk: Critical - Misrouting leads to service delays and SLA breaches
preconditions: Service Center A exists with Polygon A and Brand A auth; User address is inside Polygon A
test_steps: 1. Create Service Request via API with coordinates inside Polygon A; 2. Trigger routing engine; 3. Verify Service Center A is assigned; 4. Verify 'Round-Robin' counter increments if multiple centers match
expected_result: Request assigned to Service Center A; Audit log created; Notification sent
test_data_needs: GeoJSON polygons; User coordinates; Service Center metadata
success_criteria: Routing completes in <250ms; 100% accuracy on boundary cases
failure_impact: High - Service unavailability in specific regions

test_description: Verify data consistency when technician completes job offline and syncs upon reconnection
business_risk: High - Data loss leads to billing disputes and lost service history
preconditions: Technician logged in; Job data cached locally; Network disconnected
test_steps: 1. Disable network; 2. Update job status to 'Resolved'; 3. Capture signature; 4. Re-enable network; 5. Verify background sync pushes data
expected_result: Job status updated on backend; Signature uploaded to Blob; Local queue cleared
test_data_needs: Active Service Request; Local WatermelonDB seed
success_criteria: Zero data loss; Sync completes within 30s of reconnection
cleanup_requirements: Reset local DB; Clear backend records
performance_expectations: Sync payload optimized for low bandwidth
